a-1.etymology: ünlem radikali + Latin alfabesi küçük harfi A; radikal noktasız bir ünlem işaretinden (!). karş. o

a-3.commentary: This is likely not the earliest instance of this glyph, but there is no known earlier one.

akesi-1.etymology: hayvan radikali; kertenkele piktogramı. ayrıca radikal gözleri betimler

akesi-2.commentary: This glyph was created independently by many people. At the earliest, it appears in linja sike's first beta, but there it is not an independent glyph- it can only be accessed by stacking akesi with another glyph.

ala-1.etymology: X simgesi, olumsuzluk için dillerarası bir sembol

anpa-1.etymology: konum radikali + "kutu"; ikincisi belki de genel bir cisimi (karş. sinpin) ya da kabı (karş. poki) temsil eden eksik bir kareden. radikal için, blissymbols'da noktaların kullanımına bakınız; karş. blissymbol "below"

ante-1.etymology: belki de sama'nın değiştirilmesi sonucu, ya da sama ve ala'nın bir karması. belki de iki çizginin sapmasını temsil eden bir ideyogram

awen-1.etymology: bir hareket radikali; dik durmayı temsil eden zıt yönlü bacaklar

epiku-1.commentary: The earlier version of this glyph by TheDarkBomber more closely resembles the design of Reddit's upvote, but that design was replaced by the thinner design.

esun-1.etymology: para birimi sembolünden değil (sonja onayladı; dedi ki "sanırım o Mikmaq'tan" ama benzer bir mikmaq sembolü bulamadı).

ijo-1.etymology: genel bir cisim için bir çember

ike-1.etymology: somurtan bir ağız piktogramı. karş. pona

jami-1.commentary: This glyph went through a few revisions before this version created by jan Sa and lipamanka. For example: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/743016537845399562

jan-1.etymology: kafa radikali; omuzları gösteren bir insan piktogramı

jo-1.etymology: belki de kendine işaret eden ya da bir şey tutan bir insan radikali

kala-2.commentary: The given earliest known glyph is somewhat silly, but it is an apt and intentional representation of the kala glyph with eyes.

kama-1.etymology: hareket radikali; sola bakan bacaklar. karş. tawa ve blissymbol "walk"

kapesi-1.commentary: The earliest known version of this glyph has an overlapping triangle and circle. This is not considered a problem, as this minor variation is only distinguished by the various glyphs for olin.

ken-1.etymology: belki de Latin alfabesi K harfinden

kili-1.etymology: bir meyve piktogramı, belki de bir elma

kokosila-2.commentary: It is not currently known whether this glyph was created by jan Same or if it was taken from a prior reference.

kon-1.etymology: ideyogram; gazın akışkanlığını belirtmek için dalgalı hatlar. karş. telo

konwe-1.commentary: This glyph has been independently created a few times; the currently known earliest instance is likely not the earliest, especially based on the followin conversation: https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647
konwe-1.etymology: Conway'in Game Of Life oyununda oyun tahtası üzerinde hareket eden bir makine olan planörün piktogramı.

ku-1.etymology: toki pona yamalı bir ceketi resmeden "Toki Pona Dictionary"'nin ön kapağının piktogramı.

kule-1.etymology: renk radikali; belki de yatay çizgi "fikrin kendisi"ni belirtmekte. ya da belki bir prizmadan geçen ışık piktogramı (renk radikali)

kulijo-1.commentary: jan Lepeka reports to have created the lete version of kulijo, but we have not found the source. https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647

kulupu-1.etymology: yuvarlaklarla gösterilmiş üç mensuptan oluşan bir grup piktogramı

la-1.etymology: belki de blissymbol "later" ve "ago" ile alakalı, ya da belki bir parantez

lanpan-2.commentary: The flipped pana version of lanpan is likely older than currently known.

lanpan-3.commentary: The 'mistake' version of lanpan is named such at least two independent authors of it misinterpreted somebody else's handwriting, taking the tiny unclosed loop to be an intentional feature of the glyph.

lape-2.commentary: An earliest instance of this glyph exists primarily by coincidence. It does depict the lape glyph, but the intention of the author seems to be to draw a face on the mu glyph, as opposed to representing the word lape with a new glyph. https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/811689197504823306

lawa-1.etymology: head radical; perhaps the horizontal line for the same reason as in kule. alternatively perhaps a pictogram of a person wearing a cap

lili-1.etymology: suli'ye göre daha küçük bir boyutu temsil eden ideyogram

lon-1.etymology: çizgi üstünde konum radikali. karş. blissymbol "over"

lupa-1.etymology: içbükey bir yüzeyin piktogramı. karş. nena

ma-1.etymology: belki de modern astronomik sembol olan "dünya"dan (⊕)

mama-1.etymology: kafa radikali; belki de çocuğu temsil eden daha küçük daire

mani-1.etymology: inek gibi büyük bir evcil hayvanın piktogramı (sonja tarafından doğrulandı)

meli-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'meli-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

mi-1.etymology: belki konuşmacıya işaret eden bir el. karş. sina ve ona

mije-1.etymology: belki geniş omuzlu kafa radikali. karş. jan

mije-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'mije-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

moli-1.etymology: kafa radikali; çapraz gözlerle temsil edilen ölü bir kişi

monsuta-1.etymology: çizgi filmlerde görülen sarsıntının görsel temsili

musi-1.etymology: belki pembe yanaklarla gülümseyen bir piktogram veya bir lir

mute-1.etymology: üç çentik işaretinden oluşan ideogram. karş. wan ve tu

mute-2.commentary: This was created as a ligature in Nishiki Teki on 11-02-2022, but not acknowledged as a "mute" glyph until Sonja posted it on 01-01-2024 and explicitly called such on 01-17-2024.

nasa-1.etymology: belki de Japon manga ve animelerinde sıklıkla görülebileceği gibi "baş dönmesi"ni temsil eden spiral

nasin-1.etymology: dikey bir çizgi boyunca uzanan bir oktan oluşan ideogram

nena-1.etymology: dışbükey bir yüzeyin piktogramı. karş. lupa

ni-2.commentary: It is likely that left ni was derived earlier, as the idea of 'ni' pointing any direction has developed independently several times. Some mentions of earlier sightings exist, such as here: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/876636350214979614/928536305028169769

ni-3.commentary: The source of the glyph references it as both 'epiku' and 'turned ni'.

ni-4.commentary: The original source is an ASCII rendering of the glyph, and referenced as "eni".  The contraction "eni" was only used a few dozen times in total, but the right-arrow rendering of ni remained and was added to linja sike 5 on 2021-08-31.

nimi-1.etymology: belki bir isim etiketinin veya sitelen pona kartuşunun piktogramı

noka-1.etymology: ayak bileği olan bir ayağın piktogramı

o-1.etymology: ünlem radikali + Latin küçük harfi O. karş. a

olin-1.etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin.

olin-2.etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin.

ona-1.etymology: belki yanlara işaret eden bir el. karş. mi ve sina

pika-1.commentary: The earliest known instance of this glyph is by nimi Elemenopi, but it was called linluwi and not pika. It is not known where this glyph came to be called pika, but it is believed that this glyph developed independently from other abstract representations of electricity. https://www.reddit.com/r/tokipona/comments/hxzvew

pimeja-1.etymology: renk radikali; belki de ışığın yokluğunu temsil eden çarpı

pu-1.etymology: pictogram of the cover of the book “Toki Pona: The Language of Good”. alternatively a semantic compound glyph of lipu and toki pona

san-1.commentary: This glyph for san may have been developed independently multiple times.

seli-1.etymology: belki de yanan bir kamp ateşi piktogramı ya da basitleştirilmiş bir ateş piktogramı

sike-1.etymology: iki yuvarlak, belki de ijo'dan ayırt etmek için. alternatif olarak kalın bir boş yuvarlağın anahattı

sina-1.etymology: belki de dinleyiciye işaret eden bir el. karş. mi ve ona

sitelen-1.etymology: belki de bir parça kağıt (lipu) üzerinde birtakım sembolün bir temsili

soko-1.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

soko-3.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

su-1.etymology: Oz Büyücüsü resimli hikaye kitabının ön kapağının, hikayedeki sarı tuğla yolu gösteren piktogramı

suli-1.etymology: lili'ye kıyasla daha büyük boyutu gösteren ideogram

tan-1.etymology: sağdan sola doğru işaret eden, türetme veya neden ima eden sıçrayan ok

tawa-1.etymology: hareket radikali; bacaklar sağa bakıyor. karş. kama ve blissymbol “walk”

tenpo-2.commentary: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/340307145373253642/798480104237039636 earlier instance of the glyph but for "ten" , 01/12/2021

toki-1.etymology: emitters + ijo or a general circle

tu-1.etymology: iki çentik. karş. mute ve wan

unpa-1.etymology: belki kalp sembolünün bir türevi (özellikle karakterin orijinal çiziminden görülebilen) veya cinsel ilişkiyi ima eden bir düğüm deseni veya belki de bir cinsel organ piktogramı

usawi-1.commentary: The glyph 'nasa with emitters' was created on 2020-03-24 by jan Tumu, but the glyph would not be called usawi until independently created by jan Seli in 2021. https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/375591429608570881/692078503151009892

uta-2.commentary: jan Misali's "sitelen pona tan pu" font from 2016-09-06 depicts dotless uta. However, it is not considered the source of dotless uta today, as the font was and is essentially unknown, having only 11 downloads as of March 2025. Access the font here: https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/1315854/sitelen-pona-tan-pu

walo-1.etymology: renk radikali; belki pimeja'nın tersi, renk radikali çaprazın kesilmesi yerine tam tersi

wan-1.etymology: belki daha belirgin hale getirmek için bir çentik işareti veya Hint-Arap rakamı 1

wawa-1.etymology: belki de gücü ifade etmek için kollarını kaldırmış bir kişinin piktogramı

weka-1.etymology: "puf çizgileri"; kaybolan bir şeyin hareketini belirtir
